metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1774 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The chase_port function in drivers/usb/serial/io_ti.c in the Linux kernel before 3.7.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) via an attempted /dev/ttyUSB read or write operation on a disconnected Edgeport USB serial converter. A flaw was discovered in the Edgeort USB serial converter driver when the device is disconnected while it is in use. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1774` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
